ingredients: 2 pounds boneless country-style pork ribs, cut into 1-inch cubes
1 (2 inch) piece fresh ginger root, peeled and chopped
instructions: In a large bowl combine the chili garlic sauce, soy sauce, ginger, sesame oil and brown sugar and whisk to form a marinade.
Add the cubed pork to the marinade and let sit for 20 minutes.
Heat an indoor grill pan or outdoor grill to medium-high heat.
Thread the marinated cubes of pork on skewers, about 4 to 5 pieces per skewer.
Transfer the skewers to the grill and cook, uncovered, turning to brown evenly every 2 to 3 minutes until tender, about 10 minutes.
title: Spicy Korean Pork Skewers
steps: In a large bowl combine the chili garlic sauce, soy sauce, ginger, sesame oil and brown sugar and whisk to form a marinade. Add the cubed pork to the marinade and let sit for 20 minutes.
Heat an indoor grill pan or outdoor grill to medium-high heat.

Thread the marinated cubes of pork on skewers, about 4 to 5 pieces per skewer. Transfer the skewers to the grill and cook, uncovered, turning to brown evenly every 2 to 3 minutes until tender, about 10 minutes. Serve immediately.
